TEXT.TITLE: USDA REPORTS CORN SOLD TO USSR
TEXT.BODY: Private exporters reported sales of 125,000 tonnes of U.S. corn to the Soviet Union for delivery during the 1987/88 season and under the fifth year of the Long Term Grain Supply Agreement. The department noted the sales are the first reported for delivery during the fifth year of the Agreement, which began October 1, 1987. Sales of wheat and corn to the USSR for delivery during the fourth year of the agreement totaled 8,182,500 tonnes -- 4,080,500 tonnes of wheat and 4,102,300 tonnes of corn. In addition, sales of soybeans totaled 68,200 tonnes, it said. Reuter
